learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate a critical and in-depth understanding of key topics in an area of psychology.
Demonstrate an ability to communicate orally and in writing about a topic in an area of psychology.
Demonstrate an understanding of how different types of research methods can contribute to our understanding of an area of psychology.
Effectively engage with others to discuss and evaluate empirical research.

The purpose of this assessment piece is to prepare students for each week's seminar. For this reason, students must log their journal entry on a week-by-week basis before the due time and due date in the following weeks:


Reflect + Prep Learning Journal (Part 1)

  • Journal entry #1: Week 2
  • Journal entry #2: Week 3
  • Journal entry #3: Week 4
  • Journal entry #4: Week 6
  • Journal entry #5: Week 7


Reflect + Prep Learning Journal (Part 2)

  • Journal entry #6: Week 8
  • Journal entry #7: Week 9
  • Journal entry #8: Week 10
  • Journal entry #9: Week 11
  • Journal entry #10: Week 13


Journal entries will be marked in batches on two occasions throughout the semester. The final journal entry from the first half of the semester must be completed BEFORE the due time 1PM of Thursday in Week 7. The final journal entry from the second half of the semester must be completed BEFORE the due time 1PM of Thursday in Week 13. Within each batch, only the marks from your top 4 of 5 journal entries will count toward your final mark. Late submissions will not receive any marks. No extensions will be granted for this assessment piece.
assessments.category: Notebook/ Logbook, Participation/ Student contribution, Reflection
assessments.task_description: The 'Reflect + Prep Learning Journal' is designed to provide students a structured approach to being ready to engage meaningfully in each week's seminar. For this assessment, students will log their reflections on their learning from the previous week's seminar, as well as the prep work for the upcoming week's seminar. There will be opportunities for a total of 10 journal entries throughout the semester.
assessments.submission_guidelines: To submit your assignment electronically, log in to http://learn.uq.edu.au with your UQ username and password, then click on PSYC4881>>Assessment>>Assignment submission portals, and then use the appropriate assignment submission link. No e-mailed submissions will be accepted. The final timestamp provided on each journal entry will be considered as the submission time of each entry. Further instructions and details will be provided in Week 1 of the seminar.

assessments.late_submission: Journal entries that are submitted after Thursday 1PM of each week listed above will not receive any marks.

The task sheet with more details about this assessment, along with the marking criteria sheet, will be available on the course Blackboard site.
